text: today on x cast a massive truck bomb in
Mogadishu kills dozens with a Shabaab
Islamic group claiming responsibility
and three Americans win the nobel prize
in physics for discovering dark energy a
force crucial to the expansion of the
universe dark energy is winning the
Nobel Prize this is amazing and apple
announces its latest iPhone hoping to
slow the explosive growth of its
archrival Android this is Jeffrey
gentleman reporting for the New York
Times from Nairobi Kenya today an
enormous suicide bomb exploded in the
capital of Somalia Mogadishu killing
dozens of people possibly as many as 100
the Shabab Islamic group took credit for
the attack they are a group of Islamic
militants connected to al Qaeda who have
been fighting Somalia's transitional
government for the past several years
they have done a number of suicide
attacks before but this is one of the
biggest they have ever pulled off and
one of the deadliest the Shabaab's
target was a government compound that
housed several ministries and they said
in statement after the bombing that
there were a number of young Somali
students who were going to work in Sudan
as five however the information we've
received is that there was no such thing
that there were indeed a number of
students at this government compound
because they were waiting for news about
scholarships and exam result and they
had gathered at this government compound
which is in a very busy intersection or
near a busy intersection of Mogadishu
and a Shabaab attack there
the shebab announced they were
withdrawing from Mogadishu in August and
we believe this was because they were
suffering a lot of casualties trying to
fight the better arm peacekeeping force
however they've out at the time in
August that they would change the
tactics to do more guerrilla tactics and
you know presumably suicide tactics and
they have done this before and I think
that's what we're seeing three Americans
won the nobel prize in physics for
discovering dark energy a mysterious
force behind the expansion of the
universe science reporter Dennis over B
has been reporting on their discoveries
for years this morning I'm sitting in
front of my computer it's a quarter to
six and I'd already started writing an
article based on who I thought was going
to win the Nobel Prize I turned out to
be wrong it certainly was a surprise to
me when I found out today three
astronomers Brian Schmidt Saul
Perlmutter and Adam riess won the nobel
prize for physics for an amazing
discovery about the universe some people
think is probably the most important
discovery in the physical sciences in
the last generation this year's nobel
prize in physics is about our entire
universe they found that the expansion
of the universe is speeding up everybody
thought that the expansion of the
universe would be slowing down just as
if you toss your keys in the air they'll
give your fat their hand going to
certain speed but they'll go slow and
slower as they get higher and higher
eventually maybe they'll they'll fall
back down to the ground the universe is
actually being blown apart by some
mysterious entity we call dark energy
nobody really knows what dark energy is
and if it keeps up the universe and a
few trillion years will be completely
empty up eventually what will happen was
that all the other galaxies that we can
see from the earth will disappear from
view all we'll see are the stars in the
Milky Way they're not going anyplace
because we're all together in this one
galaxy but those stars will slowly wink
out they run out of fuel and burn
out and eventually the sky will be dark
and apple announces its latest iPhone
after much anticipation Apple introduced
the long-awaited iphone 4s not the
iphone 5 as many had hoped a slightly
different phone not a totally new design
as many were hoping but under the hood
the phone actually was a totally
different device seven times faster has
a brand-new camera an entirely new
operating system with lots of new
features so the big question now for
Apple is how much this sharpens its
competition with Google one of the key
things that Apple introduced today was
voice recognition technology called Siri
that actually allows the user to speak
into the phone and ask for directions
asked to look up information on
Wikipedia scheduled appointments ask the
phone if the user has any current
appointments which is supposed to be a
new step forward in terms of securities
or what we've seen the iphone is being
able to do before now so the other
interesting piece of news that was
revealed today is that the iphone 4s
will be sold on sprint as well as 18 T
and Verizon so that's now three out of
the four major carriers in the US which
helps give Apple a little bit of an edge
in terms of competing with Android which
many people may not know but is actually
outselling apple in terms of number
devices because hundreds of phone makers
cell devices running Android instead of
just one as is the case with Apple
